answers.answer: You can google.Antibodies may never disappear, they might go dormant to reappear again in the future.  THEY are not curable nor treatable, nothing can be done about them. Science has not figured how they are created, a cure or a  treatment. Its the immune system that creates the antibodies that attacks certain areas of the body that needs the cure. Science is just touching the tip of this area and diabetes is the first close break through.Once the trigger is identify and act upon, whether by stress reduction or medication or both, might lesson the impact of the antibodies symptoms.I am sure science will find the answer, but not in my life time or perhaps yours.

question: Hi,I posted this question under another thread title, but I'm wondering if anyone out there has experience (knowledge or personal story or ideas or literature or weblink) about how to identify what could trigger an autoimmune attack?  Someone told me that once you identify this trigger, the anti-thyroid antibodies can disappear.Thanks,Wendy
title: Ideas of how to identify trigger of autoimmunte attack?
